327CF27948444656941A22C303B75F35.description: Identify signs and symptoms of PTSD and the resources available for treatment.

on scene assessment.

22B7A683CBD6483294D9D5B8444988E0.description: Recognize life-threatening situations. The student will be able to:

Discuss and demonstrate Hazardous Waste Operations and Emergency Response (HAZWOPER) standard, 29 CFR 1910.120 –First
Responder Awareness Level (https://www.osha.gov/emergency-preparedness/hazardous-waste-operations/standards).

D712F8067B214079963139EAFA25F06C.description:
Demonstrate a basic understanding of the Incident Command System (ICS) implemented by the Federal Emergency Management
Agency (FEMA).

2A7DC6032CEA4C5486905EE11EC56934.description: Demonstrate knowledge of the operating procedures during a terrorist event or during a natural or man-made disaster.

A052F08FB87D408A8F24292B0A25EC29.description: Work as a member of a team to carry out patient care procedures at the locations of multiple casualty incidents.

31C6C6D6F3C64CCDB6F9959F1ADF4642.description: Work as a member of a team to perform patient assessments at locations of multiple casualty incidents.

9A64D08877314BC4B77CCCBB61B1ED70.description: Work as a member of a team to perform triage at locations of multiple casualty incidents.

22340DC4CCA1495395C4DEF09F3C0733.description:
Use triage tags or other identification devices available locally to indicate priorities for pre-hospital emergency care and transportation
to medical facilities.

D91E1726B14F420683D06C6F836FE049.description: Categorize the victims of multiple casualty incidents according to the severity of injury or illness based on patient assessments.

E4D7D33C9C9949259F6DC24867C375EA.description: Provide triage to victims of multiple casualty incidents. The student will be able to:

E8C10CBE309E4FAC99ED8CFFD95BB524.description: Care for the injured/ill physically disabled.

B9D0AB9BB0C741668AC10D12881C10D8.description: Identify and care for patients who are in special situations. The student will be able to:

Identify and care for a patient suffering from an environmental emergency including heat cramps, heat exhaustion, heat stroke, and
frostbite, utilizing patient assessment.

332987C11B204F2E9DD29F3CE0BA2747.description:
Identify and care for a patient with thermal, chemical, or electrical burns, determining the severity including degree, body surface
area, type, and location.

C664BB07DFF441A8B13DDA9489CDED4D.description: Identify and care for a patient who has a foreign body in the eye utilizing patient assessment.

5B322E34E21C48E5BBBD631A54817342.description: Identify and care for a patient who is experiencing a stroke utilizing patient assessment.

256F344DA3B34A5794A0F0739B0F3B45.description: Identify and care for a patient who is in an altered state of consciousness utilizing patient assessment.

D29829A6F2F343248F9E4F7D2F8A3DBF.description: Identify and care for a patient who has ingested, inhaled, absorbed, or been injected with a poisonous substance.

3D853DE96C934C19A1A1C8EB25732D06.description: Identify and care for a patient who is experiencing a seizure utilizing patient assessment.

9941DBA472D0403889F28F9F44C19083.description: Identify and care for patients experiencing a diabetic emergency utilizing patient assessment.

B7DE2B899A3245B790922CF1A896BD0B.description:

998C28898A4D4ED695939DABD87DB00D.description: Provide emergency evacuation and transfer of a sick and/or injured person. The student will be able to:

601351C947E041AFAB6DF9FDC399A592.description: Secure patient to spinal motion restriction device.

CDB924A9047F452A88F07A01C22635B7.description: Place patient in supine position on appropriate spine board based on patient condition.

1F3ED5A9BB9C45598A645014BCD7731E.description: Place proper fitting rigid extrication-type cervical collar.

CF9B54B984F34CACB4655BAE3CE42E65.description: Maintain in-line spinal motion restriction of cervical spine.

A8740FA3731D4EAD99ED91A2F7A8F850.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the function and need for traction splints.

3EF5D1F4124D47739A5C250BE584DABB.description:
Immobilize and otherwise care for suspected fractures, dislocations, sprains, and strains with available supplies and equipment,

48A2FD13200E41859F4C2258009BEEE9.description: Identify musculoskeletal injuries. The student will be able to:

690BF673099A469A95F25C975F9AA123.description: Interview the sick or injured person to obtain facts relevant to the person's condition.

CD44A4BCF2E343BFAFC6AF74E1AFED00.description: Conduct a methodical head-to-toe physical examination to discover conditions not found during the primary assessment.

F54A6A3983F344F6AC01C755FFFAA8CE.description:
Use available mechanical devices to assure the maintenance of an open airway and assist ventilation according to American Heart

F0DB695C801645C1BD6F340DF3C0E7AC.description: Recognize the likelihood that shock may occur or be present based on patient assessment and observation of a mechanism of injury.

854A277579A343729704C68FC79CE6D7.description:

standards.

F3BBAC5997844FE38F73D2957A67876C.description: Care for a patient who exhibits the signs and symptoms of internal bleeding.

F21C1A8578614D759A6764E13B3F1A2F.description: Identify the likelihood of internal bleeding through observations of signs, symptoms, and mechanisms of injury.

798EEBD702C340A595C32A02C8208C6B.description:
Apply pressure dressings, tourniquets, and wound packing that will control bleeding/hemorrhage and minimize the contamination of
open wounds.

F0E94148090344B499B5555920EE93DF.description: Recognize and control bleeding. The student will be able to:

92E3947F31804F969A0597200A61E83C.description: Restore breathing and circulation by means of cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR).

47332C71B7344328B2633749EF215711.description: Establish and maintain an open airway using both manual and mechanical airway techniques.

A719B49A7B164F4F936F27CAB5F1AEDE.description: Recognize when immediate correction is necessary.

9A03A684D27149888E0EAB17D4263D94.description: Assess for an inadequate airway, inadequate respirations, inadequate circulation, and profuse bleeding.

EFD36BC8B57D40E9915A38353E44551D.description: Conduct a primary assessment of problems that are a threat to life if not corrected immediately. The student will be able to:

DB48B7FA38A34AFC8E410231A1BD7F84.description: Use medical identification devices. The student will be able to:

9A267F3361B745629C1CFBCB27364A23.description: Determine and record skin color, temperature and moistness.

5EDB75C12FF243FC9D880DA3595CF519.description: Determine and record vital signs of a sick or injured person. The student will be able to:

Describe and demonstrate an understanding of the medicolegal aspects of an Emergency Medical Responder’s provision of
emergency medical care in the jurisdiction having authority, including, but not limited to, duty to act, standard of care, consent to
care, forcible restraint, abandonment, documentation and any applicable Good Samaritan Laws.

66E9913B27084A1993A979AD691B7961.description: Communicate the Emergency Medical Responder’s observations and actions to whomever patient care is transferred.

9950023C97F1444ABB70CB854602C12E.description: Describe information regarding a patient's condition and treatment that needs to be communicated.

9BB991E4E32A422B8C07CD66557F0893.description: Describe principles of safely operating a ground ambulance.

739DAF600BFA4473B6E0CCB20C2211E0.description: Describe the role of Emergency Medical Responder as a member of the EMS team.
